channel.title: Probability question
channel.description:
The questions are all in italics
[b][i]Omar has a disc with a pointer that spins about the centre. When the centre is stopped, it stops on one of the numbers 1, 2, 3 or 4. The probability that it will stop on one of the numbers 1 to 3 is given in the table.
1. 0.35 2. 0.16 3. 0.27 4. .... [/i][/b]
[b][i]a) work out the probability that the pointer will stop on 4 [/i][/b] My answer was 0.22
[b][i]b) work out the probability that the pointer will stop on 1 or 3 [/i][/b] My answer was 0.62
[b][i]c) Omar is going to spin the pointer 75 times. Work out an estimate for the number of times the pointer will stop on 2[/i][/b]
This is the one I'm having trouble with :L There is obviously a relation between the probability of a certain outcome and the number of times the event is repeated, but I'm having trouble getting it.
If you are going to post the answer, please show your working as well.
